Description: Fragment of undyed, linen, plain on one side and on the other covered with rows of loops (c.2.5cm long); folding (c. 4cm deep/run-and-fell structure) allows the fragment to be identified as from the waist area of a tunic; warp-undyed linen (S/c.35), weft-undyed linen (S/c.20); rows of loops every c.1 cm, each loop seems to cross 4 warp threads, the thread then passing behind 1 weft before making the next loop, c.18-20 picks main weftper row of loops; all edges fragmentary; one row of run-and-fell stitch in linen (S spun Z ply)
Curator's comments: Unreg. 7; found 1988? in packet in Keeper's Office
